intro: Polygala vulgaris var. hispanica, commonly known as the Spanish milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, pale green to yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slight hairy texture. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
